paper_abstract: In this article, we consider the two 4-hop-constrained paths problem, which consists, given a graph G = (N, E) and two nodes s, t is an element of N, of finding a minimum cost sub-graph in G containing at least two node- (resp., edge-) disjoint paths of length at most 4 between s and t. We give integer programming formulations, in the space of the design variables, for both the node and edge versions of this problem. (c) 2006 Wiley Periodicals, Inc.
paper_title: Integer programming formulations for the two 4-hop-constrained paths problem
